SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: A few cases of cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT) were reported after a lumbar puncture (LP), suggesting a causal association
The purpose of our study was to document that LP might predispose to CVT by decreasing blood flow velocities (BFV) in veins or dural sinus
METHODS: We performed a transcranial Doppler ultrasound study to register the mean BFV of the straight sinus (SS) before, during and after LP
LP induced a decrease of 47% of mean BFV in the SS
The mean decrease of BFV was significant immediately at the end (p = 0.003), 30 min after (p = 0.015) and more than 6 h after LP (p = 0.008)
CONCLUSIONS: LP induced a sustained decrease of mean BFV in the SS
The decrease of venous blood flow is a possible mechanism contributing to the occurrence of CVT
